availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Wood (Eddyville, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and carrier)

body.p: Eddyville, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and carrier. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary A. Wood. Father of Edmond Wood, Archer Wood, and Charles Wood. Merchant in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer and carrier in Eddyville in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 328; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Eddyville, p. 105; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 13.
